SEARCH
Package sh.brane.core.crypto

Interface Signer

All Known Implementing Classes:
PrivateKeySigner
public interface Signer
Defines a signer capable of signing transactions and providing its address.

This interface unifies the signing capabilities, allowing for various implementations such as local private keys, external KMS, or hardware wallets.

  • Method Details

    • address

      Address address()
      Returns the address associated with this signer.
      Returns:
      the Ethereum address

    • signTransaction

      Signature signTransaction(UnsignedTransaction tx, long chainId)
      Signs a transaction and returns the raw signature.

      The client is responsible for assembling the final signed transaction envelope.

      Parameters:
      tx - the unsigned transaction to sign
      chainId - the chain ID for replay protection
      Returns:
      the raw signature of the transaction hash
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if tx is null

    • signMessage

      Signature signMessage(byte[] message)
      Signs a raw message according to EIP-191 (personal_sign).

      The implementation is responsible for prefixing the message with "Ethereum Signed Message:\n" + message.length before hashing and signing. The returned signature should have a v value of 27 or 28.

      Parameters:
      message - the raw message bytes to sign (must not be null)
      Returns:
      the EIP-191 compatible signature
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if message is null

    • signTypedData

      default Signature signTypedData(Eip712Domain domain, String primaryType, Map<String,List<TypedDataField>> types, Map<String,Object> message)
      Signs typed data according to EIP-712.
      Parameters:
      domain - the EIP-712 domain
      primaryType - the primary type name
      types - type definitions
      message - message data
      Returns:
      signature with v=27 or v=28

    • signTypedData

      default Signature signTypedData(TypedData<?> typedData)
      Signs typed data according to EIP-712.

      Convenience overload for the type-safe TypedData API.

      Parameters:
      typedData - the typed data to sign
      Returns:
      signature with v=27 or v=28
